bibl.author: Kāṇhapa
Sumatikīrti
dge slong grags pa shes rab

notesStmt.note: Last updated at 07/09/2018 at 10:10:48 by admin

The Sanskrit title is not provided in the root text, but is given in the commentary (Toh. 1452). There is a commentary in the Sakya tradition of Vajrayogini by Jamyang Khyentse Wangpo (rje btsun rdo rje rnal ‘byor ma nA ro mkha’ spyod kyi bskyed rdzogs dmigs khrid mkha’ spyod ‘khrid pa’i sa mkhan mdzes par byed pa’i rgyan), in which it is stated that “These personal instructions of the uncommon ultimate secret yoga were extensively [explained] by the ācārya Kṛṣṇācārya; he pulled out the essence of the meaning of all the root and explanatory tantras of Cakrasaṃvara and explained them in [the work] known in the language of the ḍākiṇīs as Olapati and in the Tibetan language as The Four Stages” (rnal 'byor gsang mtha' thun mong ma yin pa'i man ngag 'di la rgyas par slob dpon nag po spyod pas dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i rtsa bshad kyi rgyud thams cad kyi don gyi bcud phyung ste bkral ba, mkha' 'gro brda'i skad du, o la pa ti ste bod skad du rim par bzhi par grags pa).
